heaviest_rainfall.status: On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 36.8mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 4.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 36.8mm.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning strikes in one day since 11 April 2025 is 23 and it happened on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: No stormy weather is anticipated.  The last big storm was recorded on 21 September 2025, lasting 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (185°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (233.0°) by approximately 48.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: 1737 miles is the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the inside temperature (down 1.9°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 5%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 407 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 50.3°C), dew point temperature (up 46.0°C), outside temperature (up 50.0°C), and cloud levels (up 973 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 407.1m lower than yesterday, 972.6m lower than the past week, 566.8m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 929m and a peak of 2240m, averaging 1138.0m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.
cloud levels.summary: Cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should remain cool. Outside; cold weather is expected. Also, the atmosphere will feel parched and dry and calm and still conditions are expected. A few light raindrops may fall, cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times, and the light is absent. Weather patterns to stay the same.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (91%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
